actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Roll Call 541
actions-list.actionItem: 2/3 Yea and Nay vote pending.
Considered as unfinished business. S. 3773 — "To authorize the leases of up to 99 years for land held in trust for the Confederated Tribes of the Chehalis Reservation."
The Chair announced that the unfinished business was the question on the motions to suspend the rules, which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: (Roll no. 540).
Considered as unfinished business. S. 1942 — "To standardize the designation of National Heritage Areas, and for other purposes."
The Chair announced that the unfinished business was the question on passage of S. 1942, which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: (Roll no. 539).
Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 9640 — "To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide for examination and disclosure with respect to Presidential income tax returns."
The Chair announced that the unfinished business was the question on passage of H.R. 9640, which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.

The House received a communication from The Honorable Burgess Owens. Representative Owens notified the House that he had been served with a subpoena for documents issued by the Third Judicial District Court, Salt Lake County, State of Utah and that after consultation with the Office of General Counsel, he determined that compliance would be consistent with the privileges and rights of the House.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 3405.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Pallone moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 3405 — "To require the Federal Communications Commission to issue a rule providing that certain low power television stations may be accorded primary status as Class A television licensees, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 1541.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Pallone moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 1541 — "To amend the Communications Act of 1934 to require the Federal Communications Commission to ensure just and reasonable charges for telephone and advanced communications services in correctional and detention facilities."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 4120.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Pallone moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 4120 — "To maximize discovery, and accelerate development and availability, of promising childhood cancer treatments, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 4978.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Pallone moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 4978 — "To amend the Public Health Service Act to reauthorize the State offices of rural health program."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 1294.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Meeks moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 1294 — "To authorize the imposition of sanctions with respect to foreign persons that have engaged in significant theft of trade secrets of United States persons, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 3946.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Nadler moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 3946 — "To reauthorize the Trafficking Victims Protection Act of 2017, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 3949.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Nadler moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 3949 — "To reauthorize the Trafficking Victims Protection Act of 2000, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 4240.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Nadler moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 4240 — "To amend section 2441 of title 18, United States Code, to broaden the scope of individuals subject to prosecution for war crimes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 5328.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Ms. Spanberger moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 5328 — "To amend the Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 to extend terminal lakes assistance."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 3519.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Tonko moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 3519 — "To amend the National Trails System Act to designate the Butterfield Overland National Historic Trail, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 4439.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Tonko moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 4439 — "To take certain Federal land located in Siskiyou County, California, and Humboldt County, California, into trust for the benefit of the Karuk Tribe, and for other purposes."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.

At the conclusion of debate on S. 1942, the Chair put the question on passage and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Westerman demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings on passage until a time to be announced.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on S. 1942.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 9640 and S. 1942. Measure will be considered read. Bill is closed to amendments. Rule provides for one hour of debate on each measure. Also provides for a motion to recommit H.R. 9640 and a motion to commit S. 1942. H. Res. 693 and H. Res. 1434 are adopted. Provides for the Majority Leader or a designee that the House suspend the rules as though under clause 1 of rule XV with respect to multile measures.
Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 1529. S. 1942 — "To standardize the designation of National Heritage Areas, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate on H.R. 9640, the Chair put the question on passage and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Brady demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings on passage until a time to be announced.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House continued with debate on H.R. 9640.
The House received a message from the Senate. The Senate passed S. 1541, S. 3405, S. 4439, S. 4814, H.R. 680, H.R. 897, and H.R. 1154. Senate agreed to H. Con. Res. 82.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H.R. 9640.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 9640 and S. 1942. Measure will be considered read. Bill is closed to amendments. Rule provides for one hour of debate on each measure. Also provides for a motion to recommit H.R. 9640 and a motion to commit S. 1942. H. Res. 693 and H. Res. 1434 are adopted. Provides for the Majority Leader or a designee that the House suspend the rules as though under clause 1 of rule XV with respect to multile measures.

Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 1529. H.R. 9640 — "To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide for examination and disclosure with respect to Presidential income tax returns."
The House proceeded with one minute speeches which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 5 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Ms. Garcia of TX to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal. Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
